numlitem.para: Failed check valve is secured closed, and
Trim air is available from side opposite to valve which is secured closed.
With both packs operative, operate left pack in AUTO mode only.
With one pack inoperative, operate remaining pack in AUTO or STBY mode as appropriate.

placard.para: Placard near Trim Air switch "L (R) TRIM AIR INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: If both air conditioning packs are operative the failed check valve and blanking plate should be on the right side. Swap the operative valve onto the left side, if necessary, using procedures in AMM 21-61-05. If an air conditioning pack is inoperative, the failed check valve should be on the side with the inoperative pack. Swap valves, if necessary, using AMM 21-61-05.
An inoperative trim air check valve is secured closed by installing a blanking plate on the downstream side of the inoperative trim air check valve.

numlitem.para: Obtain blanking plate (213T2412-1) or manufacture per the following:
Provide electrical power (Ref. MM 24-22-00).

warning.para: REMOVE PRESSURE FROM THE PNEUMATIC SYSTEM. PRESSURE IN THE PNEUMATIC SYSTEM CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT.

numlitem.para: Remove pressure from the pneumatic system (Ref. MM 36-00-00).
Place both air conditioning pack control selectors on pilot’s overhead panel P5 in OFF position. Attach DO-NOT-OPERATE identifier to both selectors.
Lower left (right) air conditioning pack access door 193HL (194ER).
Loosen clamp on downstream side of the left (right) trim air check valve and slide clamp along duct.
Slip blanking plate between duct assembly and trim air check valve.
Reinstall clamp. Torque clamp nut to 45 inch-pounds.
Perform leakage test per the following:
Provide pneumatic power (Ref. MM 36-00-00).
Remove DO-NOT-OPERATE identifier from both air conditioning pack control selectors on P5 panel and place both selectors to AUTO position.
Press TRIM AIR switchlight, on P5 panel, to OFF position. Remove DO-NOT-OPERATE identifier from switchlight.
Check valve flange for leakage.
Diffused leakage is acceptable.
Jet blast leakage must be repaired by joint or clamp realignment.
Put the aircraft back to its usual condition:
Close left (right) air conditioning pack access door 193HL (194ER).
Remove pneumatic power (Ref. MM 36-00-00).
Remove electrical power (Ref. MM 24-22-00).
